input_text:
Job Title: Senior Construction Project Manager

Location: Fresno, CA

Employment Type: full-time

Listed Skills: Other, Project Management

Description:
Senior Project Manager - ConstructionLocation: Fresno, CAPay Range: $126-160k + BonusFull-Time, OnsiteDirect HireWe are actively seeking a seasoned & results-driven Senior Project Manager to join a leader in the underground utility construction industry! This employee-owned firm sets themselves apart with a commitment to safety, respect, professionalism, and quality of work. These values are why they’ve been able to provide construction excellence for over 50 years, working on projects of all scopes and sizes – from Engineer-Procure-Construct Manage of large-scale infrastructures to small single-entity jobs. As a Senior Project Manager, you'll be at the helm of multiple large and complex construction projects, driving their successful completion from start to finish. Your leadership will be pivotal in ensuring projects are executed safely, efficiently, and with the utmost attention to quality. As a part of the Employee Stock Ownership Plan (ESOP), you will know that your contributions are making a direct impact on the company, and that everyone on your team is as committed to the company’s success as you are. If you’re ready to join a stable, fiscally responsible firm with strong core values, apply now and call Aileen at 888-303-5627 to learn more or schedule an interview! Key Responsibilities:Project Management Excellence: Lead project teams to ensure timely and safe project completion within budget constraints. Manage project assignments, maintain status reports, track progress, and facilitate project closeouts efficiently.Business Growth: Contribute to business expansion by actively participating in bid opportunities, providing estimates, and staying attuned to industry trends and client needs.Financial Oversight: Ensure adherence to procedures and contractual requirements, oversee billing processes, analyze project costs, and provide profit status reports to management.Change Management: Review and validate change orders, communicate effectively with project teams on additional costs, and maintain accurate documentation.Stakeholder Management: Foster strong relationships with subcontractors, vendors, clients, and internal stakeholders to ensure project success and long-term commitments.Safety and Compliance: Implement and enforce safety protocols, hold teams accountable for compliance, and ensure adherence to personnel policies and procedures.Key Qualifications:5+ years of construction project manager or 8+ assistant project manager experienceUnderground utility construction experience a plusBachelor’s degree preferredStrong interpersonal, leadership, and planning skills
Benefits & PerksCompetitive benefits package Employee Stock Ownership Plan – unique opportunity to make a direct impact on the companyPaid holidays, vacation and sick timeBonus Opportunities Dynamic provides equal employment opportunities to all employees and applicants for employment and prohibits discrimination and harassment of any type without regard to race, color, religion, age, sex, national origin, disability status, genetics, protected veteran status, sexual orientation, gender identity or expression, or any other characteristic protected by federal, state, or local laws. This policy applies to all terms and conditions of employment, including recruiting, hiring, placement, promotion, termination, layoff, recall, transfer, leaves of absence, compensation, and training.

Experience Level (if available): Mid-Senior level

output_json.title: Senior Construction Project Manager
output_json.summary: Seasoned & results-driven Senior Project Manager needed for a leader in the underground utility construction industry.
job_responsibilities: Lead project teams to ensure timely and safe project completion within budget constraints.
Manage project assignments, maintain status reports, track progress, and facilitate project closeouts efficiently.
Contribute to business expansion by actively participating in bid opportunities, providing estimates, and staying attuned to industry trends and client needs.
Ensure adherence to procedures and contractual requirements, oversee billing processes, analyze project costs, and provide profit status reports to management.
Review and validate change orders, communicate effectively with project teams on additional costs, and maintain accurate documentation.
Foster strong relationships with subcontractors, vendors, clients, and internal stakeholders to ensure project success and long-term commitments.
Implement and enforce safety protocols, hold teams accountable for compliance, and ensure adherence to personnel policies and procedures.
benefits: Paid holidays, vacation and sick time
output_json.company_information: A leader in the underground utility construction industry, offering a commitment to safety, respect, professionalism, and quality of work.
output_json.equal_opportunity_policy: Dynamic provides equal employment opportunities to all employees and applicants for employment and prohibits discrimination and harassment of any type.
